<p> VRML97 and ClassicVRML encodings use the term PROTO, while XML and JSON encodings use the ProtoDeclare element. </p> <p> ProtoDeclare is a Prototype Declaration, defining a new node made up of other node(s). ProtoDeclare contains ProtoInterface and ProtoBody statements. <i>Hint:</i> ProtoDeclare is a definition only, add corresponding ProtoInstance nodes to create new instances. </p> <p> VRML97 and ClassicVRML encodings simply uses the prototype name, while XML and JSON encodings use the ProtoInstance element. </p> <p> ProtoInstance creates an instance node of a locally or externally declared prototype definition. ProtoDeclare/ExternProtoDeclare definitions are abstract, corresponding ProtoInstance nodes are concrete. ProtoInstance nodes typically contain fieldValue statements to override default field values defined in the original ProtoDeclare statement. <i>Hint:</i> the node type of a ProtoInstance exactly matches the first node in the corresponding ProtoDeclare/ProtoBody declaration. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#ExternProtoDeclare" target="_blank">ExternProtoDeclare</a> statement, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#ProtoDeclare" target="_blank">ProtoDeclare</a> statement, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#ProtoInterface" target="_blank">ProtoInterface</a> statement, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#ProtoBody" target="_blank">ProtoBody</a> statement, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#field" target="_blank">field</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#IS" target="_blank">IS</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#connect" target="_blank">connect</a>, and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#ProtoInstance" target="_blank">ProtoInstance</a> node with <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#fieldValue" target="_blank">fieldValue</a> statement. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html" target="_blank">Core component</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#Concepts" target="_blank">7.2 Concepts</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#PROTOStatement" target="_blank">7.2.5.8 PROTO statement</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter31Prototypes" target="_blank">Chapter 31 Prototypes</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter14Prototypes" target="_blank">Chapter 14 Prototypes</a> </li> </ul>
